checks.name: Bundled Tools / Dependencies
checks.notes: Python

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
The model is optimized for generative diffusion models to support tasks like 3D shape generation, reconstruction, and conditioning on text, images, or categories.
The model serves as a foundational static 3D shape representation in the proposal's objectives for Generative Modeling for 4D Data, providing the basis for extending to a spatiotemporal hierarchical vector set framework called 4DVecSet.
Aligns with the approved research topic Datascience and engineering

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation.

Jiapeng Tang - Technical University of Munich (TUM)

The affiliates are all, except one, from non-D5 countries.

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes:
ShapeNet-v2 dataset across 55 categories of man-made objects, with shapes converted to watertight meshes and sampled with 500,000 dense surface points per shape.
3D-R2N2 dataset for single-view object reconstruction, consisting of RGB images of size 224x224 rendered from 24 random viewpoints per shape.
ShapeGlot dataset for text prompts in text-driven shape generation.
Partial point clouds generated by sampling patches from full point clouds for shape completion tasks.

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes: no fine tuning of the generalized model has been reported.

checks.name: FLOPS Calculation
checks.notes:
No clear indication of the number of parameters in the model, according to the documentation. 
Though these are transformer based computer vision models they are generally smaller in size than the LLMs for text based tasks. 
Risk is raised to medium given that the FLOPs can't be evaluated with the given information.

checks.name: Sample Inspection
checks.notes: Skipping sample inspection as its KAUST own model.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
4D-VGGT is a foundation model that estimates dynamic scene geometry (camera poses, depth maps, point maps, dynamic masks, and 2D/3D point trajectories) from image/video sequences using divide-and-conquer spatiotemporal representation with cross-view global fusion and cross-time local fusion modules.

The model will be used for the project objective 2 (Combining Generative Modeling and 4D Reconstruction) .

Aligns with the approved research topic Datascience and engineering

checks.notes: No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation.

Haoyue Liu - School of AI and Automation, HUST

Luxin Yan - School of AI and Automation, HUST (yanluxin@hust.edu.cn)

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes: no license shown

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes:
Stage 1 (Per-Task Optimization): ~31.3M samples total across tasks - Camera pose (7.1M samples from Co3Dv2, WildRGB-D, ScanNet, Hypersim, Habitat, Replica), Depth (15.6M samples from BlendedMVS, DL3DV, MegaDepth, Kubric, MVS-Synth, Virtual KITTI 2), Dynamic mask (5.8M samples from Kubric, HOI4D, Dynamic-Replica), Point map (1.6M from Co3Dv2, MegaDepth, WildRGB-D, ScanNet), Tracking (1.2M from TAP-Vid)

Stage 2 (Multi-Task Optimization): 8.2M samples from TartanAir, Spring, Omniworld, SpatialVID

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes:
The model was trained end-to-end for five geometry tasks: 

(1) camera parameter estimation (intrinsics/extrinsics), 

(2) depth map estimation, 

(3) dynamic mask segmentation, 

(4) point map reconstruction, and 

(5) 2D/3D point tracking.

checks.name: FLOPS Calculation
checks.notes: no model source provided so no evaluation calculated

checks.notes: no model provided.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
a 3D asset generation model that takes text or image prompts and generates high-quality 3D assets in multiple output formats.
It could potentially support Objective 1 (Generative Modeling for 4D Data) of the proposal.

Aligns with approved research topic Datascience and engineering.

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes:
TRELLIS-500K dataset - 500,000 3D assets curated from five sources:

Objaverse(XL) - largest component
ABO (Amazon Berkeley Objects)
3D-FUTURE (Alibaba furniture dataset)
HSSD (Habitat Synthetic Scenes Dataset)
Toys4k

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes: no separate fine tuning done.

checks.name: FLOPS Calculation
checks.notes:
TRELLIS-image-large: 1.2 billion parameters
TRELLIS-text-base: 342 million parameters
TRELLIS-text-large: 1.1 billion parameters
TRELLIS-text-xlarge: 2.0 billion parameters (largest model)

Model can be considered well below the threshold given the number of parameters and the number of samples in the dataset.
